data.scheme_name: Development of Commercial Horticulture through Production and Post Harvest Management of Horticulture Crops  - Commercial Horticulture Development in open field conditions on project mode  - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides Credit linked back-ended subsidy upto 50% of the total project cost limited to Rs 37.50 lakh per project.
data.eligibility: Organizations/promoters, such as Association of Growers, Individuals, group of farmer growers/consumers, Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs,) Partnership/Proprietary Firms, Self Help Groups (SHGs), NGOs, Companies, Corporations, Cooperatives, Co-operative Marketing Federations, Agricultural Produce Marketing Committees, Marketing Boards/Committees, Municipal Corporations/ Committees, Agro Industries Corporations, SAUs and other concerned R&D organizations are eligible to get assistance under all the NHB schemes.
data.conditions:
1. Maximum Project costs allowed - Rs. 75.00 lakh/per project (Rs 125.00 lakh for date palm, olive and saffron) for projects covering an area over 2 hectares (in the case of North-Eastern Regions, 1 hectare is eligible).

data.context: The scheme was introduced to develop and boost the horticulture industry.
data.objective: Projects relating to the setting up of new units shall be technically and financially appraised to ensure and enable the entrepreneur to incorporate the latest available technology.
data.description: Credit linked back-ended subsidy at 40% of the total project cost limited to Rs 30.00 lakh per project in general areas and @ 50% of project cost limited to Rs. 37.50 lakh in Northeast Region, Hilly States and scheduled areas.
data.how_to_apply:
Online application can be made through - http://nhb.gov.in/OnlineApplication/RegistrationForm.aspx
Apply through banks and other eligible financial institutions.
data.funding_facilitator: Banks and other eligible financial institutions.
data.funding_mechanism: The eligible units will get the benefit after the approval by National Horticulture Board for claim submitted.
data.additional_info:
Norms for Technology Add on components and other essential components of Integrated Commercial Horticulture projects:

  1. Cost of Land - Admissible only if purchased newly but not before one year from date of sanction of loan Admissible Cost - Actual or up to 10 % of Eligible Project Cost (EPC) (Excluding cost of Land and Development) whichever is less subject to maximum of Rs. 50,000/ - per acre.
  2. Land Development - Includes cost of Land leveling, digging of pits, fencing, gates etc. Admissible Cost - Actual or up to 15% of Eligible Project Cost (EPC) (Excluding cost of Land and Land Development) whichever is less subject to maximum of Rs. 50,000/ - per acre
  3. Cultivation expenses - Includes cost of Planting material, cost of input (labor, fertilizer and manures, pesticides etc.) Admissible Cost - As per MIDH (NHM) cost norms as given at Appendix - 1
  4. Drip system with internal pipeline - Component includes mainline, valve, backflow preventer pressure regulator, filter, tubing adapters and fittings, drip tubing, emitters and an end cap Admissible Cost -
    • a) Actual or Rs. 20,000/-per acre for plant density up to 200 plants
    • b) Actual or Rs. 25,000/ - per acre for plant density >200 plants/acre
    • c) Sprinkler @Rs. 15,000/per acre
  5. Irrigation infrastructure excluding micro irrigation - Irrigation infrastructure like tube-well/bore well/open well, pipeline, water harvesting structure, water harvesting structure, water tank etc, admissible only if newly created with loan component Admissible Cost -
    • Actual or up to Rs. 50,000/ - per acre for open field cultivation
    • Rs. 4.00 lakh per project in case of protected cultivation
    • Component wise cost norms will be as under: -Tube-well up to Rs. 2.50 lakh per unit -Water harvesting structure - @ Rs. 100/ - CuM with use of minimum 300 microns plastic films or RCC lining. -Cost of non lined ponds/tanks will be 30% less. -Pipe line-Rs 150/ - per running meter only from source (min. 4 diameter) of irrigation to production unit
  6. Horticulture Mechanization - Power/hydraulic operated machine/tools including small farms tractor with rotavator/equipments etc., Machineries Identified by NHB under farm mechanization component may be considered for subsidy in standalone mode. Admissible Cost -
    • Tractor (up to 20 BHP) at Rs.3.00 lakh/unit
    • Power Tiller below8 BHP at Rs.1.00 lakh/unit
    • Power tiller 8 BHP & Above at Rs.1.50 lakh/unit
    • Tractor/Power Tiller (Below 20 BHP) driven equipments - Land development, tillage and seed bed preparation equipments - at Rs.0.30 lakh per unit Sowing, planting reaping and digging equipments - at Rs.0.30 Lakh per unit e) Plastic mulch laying machine at Rs.0.70 Lakh per unit
    • Self-propelled Horticulture machinery - at Rs.2.50 lakh per unit
    • Other tools and equipments as per norms as per norms of Sub Mission on Agriculture Mechanization (SMAM)
  7. Civil Infrastructure - Includes Functional Pack House/ On farm collection unit and labor quarter Admissible Cost -
    • Functional Pack house at Rs. 4 Lakh/unit with size of 9 x 6 Meter (Pro rate basis for lower size)
    • Labor Quarter/ Store room at Rs. 20,000/ - per acre maximum up to 3 lakh.
  8. VermiCompost Unit - Permanent structure and HPDE vermined Admissible Cost - Rs.60,000/ - per unit for permanent structure and Rs.10,000/ - for HDPE vermined (96 cft (12x4x2) and IS 15907:2010 to be administered on prorate basis).
  9. Certification for Good Agriculture Practice (GAP), including infrastructure Admissible Cost - Rs 4000/ - per acre
  10. Support system for Grapes (trellis, telephone, bawar and other system etc.) - Permanent structure made up of MS angles and stainless steel wire Admissible Cost - Rs 150000/ - per acre
  11. Plastic Mulching Admissible Cost - Rs Rs.12800/ - per acre and Rs.14729/ - acre for hilly states
  12. Bed Preparation Cost in the cases requiring Soil replacement - Protected Cultivation projects only in cases involving removal and replacement of top soil by red soil or cultivation is done on media/Pots/Concrete bed Admissible Cost - Rs 100/ - per sqm.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Project proposal / plan 
2. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) 
3. LOI(Letter) Applications with project cost up to Rs. 20.00 Lakh  
4. LOI Application with project outlay above 20.00 lakhs  
5. Cutting and overwriting should be avoided and duly attested 
6. The testimony should in the prescribed format only 
7. Lease/Tenancy/Contract be duly registered with the competent Registration Authority 
8. Other KYC Documents
